title: Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad Recipe
description: This spinach salad is packed with fresh spinach, toasted almonds, and dried cranberries tossed with a sweet and tangy homemade sesame seed dressing.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Green Salad Recipes Spinach Salad Recipes Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad 4.8 (4,400) 3,004 Reviews 119 Photos This spinach salad is different and so easy to make. Everyone I have made this for raves about it! Submitted by Jamie Hensley Updated on September 15, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 119 119 119 119 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 5 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 tablespoon butter ¾ cup almonds, blanched and slivered 1 pound spinach, rinsed and torn into bite-size pieces 1 cup dried cranberries Dressing: ½ cup vegetable oil ½ cup white sugar ¼ cup cider vinegar ¼ cup white wine vinegar 2 tablespoons toasted sesame seeds 1 tablespoon poppy seeds 2 teaspoons minced onion ¼ teaspoon paprika Directions Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir almonds in butter until lightly toasted. Remove from heat and let cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Make dressing: Whisk together oil, sugar, cider vinegar, white wine vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, minced onion, and paprika in a medium bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine spinach with toasted almonds and cranberries in a large serving bowl. Pour dressing over spinach mixture; toss well. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 4,560 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 338 Calories 24g Fat 30g Carbs 5g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 338 % Daily Value * Total Fat 24g 30% Saturated Fat 3g 17% Cholesterol 4mg 1% Sodium 58mg 3% Total Carbohydrate 30g 11% Dietary Fiber 4g 13% Total Sugars 23g Protein 5g 10% Vitamin C 16mg 18% Calcium 127mg 10% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 423mg 9% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Jamie's Cranberry Spinach Salad 01 of 119 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 119 Photo by  DREGINEK 12/25/2023 Jamie, this is crazy good and a big bonus to how easy it is!?! The only thing I wish I had (I purchased but forgot at home) was the addition of crumbled feta cheese. But even without, so many great flavors and textures. A great salad and paired wonderfully with our shrimp scampi tonight! Thank you! 03 of 119 Photo by  Paula 11/13/2023 I love simple salads like this! I made a single serve salad, subbed a stevia blend for the sugar, and used sliced almonds instead of slivered. So delicious! But after tasting it, I added a little feta cheese which took it over the top! 04 of 119 Photo by  trbryant1 12/29/2020 05 of 119 Photo by  Nina Greenberg 11/17/2020 A Hit! I was searching Allrecipes looking for a different dressing for my sweet slaw to go with Texas BBQ. I substituted red cabbage for the spinach (can’t get hubby to get spinach) Added carrots, and diced apple. I also used half pumpkin seeds and half almond slivers. Colorful, crunchy and sweet, hubby couldn’t get enough. Thanks Jamie! 06 of 119 Photo by  NATUREMAMA1 10/20/2020 07 of 119 Photo by  Kelsey Nay 10/11/2020 08 of 119 Photo by  Lisa 05/31/2020 09 of 119 Photo by  Jennifer Reeves 01/16/2020 10 of 119 Photo by  Rula 01/03/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Spinach and Strawberry Salad 1,792 Ratings Harvest Salad 552 Ratings Missy's Candied Walnut Gorgonzola Salad 436 Ratings Strawberry, Kiwi, and Spinach Salad 122 Ratings Winter Fruit Salad with Poppyseed Dressing 851 Ratings Spring Strawberry Spinach Salad 328 Ratings Apple, Pecan, Cranberry, and Avocado Spinach Salad with Balsamic Dressing 71 Ratings Spinach Pomegranate Salad 134 Ratings Steak and Spinach Salad 76 Ratings Pretty Pomegranate Salad 4 Ratings Spinach Salad with Poppy Seed Dressing 49 Ratings Napa Cabbage Salad 438 Ratings Beautiful Salad 355 Ratings Brunch Spinach Salad 26 Ratings Winter Green Salad 63 Ratings Lime-Garlic Chicken and Spinach Salad 22 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Jamie Hensley
instructions: Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir almonds in butter until lightly toasted. Remove from heat and let cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Make dressing: Whisk together oil, sugar, cider vinegar, white wine vinegar, sesame seeds, poppy seeds, minced onion, and paprika in a medium bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Combine spinach with toasted almonds and cranberries in a large serving bowl. Pour dressing over spinach mixture; toss well. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
